title: More efficient logic required for processing disk sorting when there is a border value for the row count
OB: When sorting data on disk with 40000 rows and setting the program to process data less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed by the program: 1. Save the file as a temporary file 2. Load the file into memory 3. Sort the data in memory 4. Save the sorted data to the temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Sort data on disk with 40000 rows. 2. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows of data. Observe the program performing the aforementioned operations.
